newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: PRESS DIGEST - Pakistan newspapers - March 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Pakistan newspapers - March 1.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Pakistani press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- At least 80 people were killed and hundreds of others injured when an earthquake of severe intensity hit vast areas of Balochistan province.
- Several areas across the country were jolted following a strong earthquake in Balochistan province capital Quetta.
- The National Tarriff Commission has prepared a package of recommendations for promoting deemed exports which has remained a neglected sector in Pakistan so far because of bureaucratic indifference.
- A woman and her five children were found slaughtered in their home in a village near Punjab provincial capital Lahore.
- The Hong Kong Shanghai Banking Corp group has offered the newly elected government to bring one billion dollars within three months if two of its privatisation projects are allowed to go through.

- Credit Lyonnais Securities Asia has advised its clients in very strong terms not to be lured by the retail euphoria on the Pakistani bourses, as they are convinced that Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif government and the International Monetary Fund are on a collision course and the prospect of a debt default by Pakistan is looming large.
- Sharif has reiterated that revolutionary changes would be brought about in the laws to recover money looted by corrupt bureaucrats and politicians and award exemplary punishment to them.
- Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif has appointed Khawaja Asif as new Chairman of the state-run Privatisation Commission.
- The government has levied 10 percent sales tax on the supplies and import of all leather, cotton and sports goods.
